headline.main: Dr. Holmes' Speech at the Recent Anniversary of the Massachusetts Medical Society.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Chair proposed the following toast: The distinguished Professor of Anatomy in Harvard University-" He touches nothing he does not adorn." In response to which, Dr. OLIVER WENDELL HOLMES said : I have no choice, Mr. Chairman, in appropriating to myself the sentiment containing the words of eulogy which you have so kindly misapplied.

docs.lead_paragraph: A Saratoga correspondent of the TIMES, a few days since, mentioned the disappearance from that place of Col. CHARLEs BURR, under circumstances which excited comment, especially as inquiries from Mr. COLE, the person who traveled with him, failed to elicit any satisfactory explanation.

headline.main: NEW-YORK CITY.; Sen-Shore Hotel. Felonious Assault and Battery. The Liquor Law. A Shot Fired. Special Sessions. Board of Police Commissioners. Military. ?? Stabbin Case. Found Drowned. COMMON COUNCIL PROCEEDINGS. Board of Councilmen. Board of Supervisors.

FOUR DAYS LATER FROM EUROPE i; ARRIVAL OF THE HERMANN. Violation of a Flag of Truce by the Russians. Dreadful Affair in the Gulf of Finland. Nothing Important from Sebastopol. Report of the Parliamentary Committee on the State of the British Army. INTERESTING FROM ITALY AND SPAIN. THE MARKETS, &C.

docs.lead_paragraph: By the United States Mail steamship Hermann, Capt. HIGGINS, at this port yesterday, we have London papers of the 20th ult. The Royal Mail steamship America arrived at Liverpool early on the morning of the 18th ult. The Hermann left Bremen on the 15th, and Southampton on the 20th ult., and brings 250 passengers and a full cargo of French, German and British merchandise.

headline.main: FOURTH OF JULY.; CELEBRATION OF INDEPENDENCE DAY. How the City Kept It, and What They Did in the Country. First Day Under the Maine Law. THE MILITARY PROCESSION. The Streets. The Fireworks Put Out. How Things Went at "the Institutions." THE TAMMANY CELEBRATION. TRIAL TRIP OF THE OCEAN BIRD. Accidents and Incidents, Fires, Lighting, Thunder and Rain. NOISE AND CONFUSION."

docs.lead_paragraph: The day was celebrated much after the usual sort. The weather was of the finest order until 4 o'clock, when a drenching shower drove the misses from the parks and streets to take shelter where they might. After another interval of sunshine, a steady rain set in, which cooled off the enthusiasm of the day marvelously. The fireworks were

headline.main: THE FOURTH IN MASSACHUSETTS.; CELEBRATION AT DORCHESTER. EDWARD EVERETT'S ORATION. History and Philosophy of the American Revolution.

byline.original: From the Special Reporter of N. Y. Daily Times

headline.main: How the Fourth was Kept on Board the Hermann.

docs.lead_paragraph: To the Editor of the New-York Daily Times: The Fourth of July on board the steamer Hermann was celebrated with much spirit. On the evening of the 3d inst., our gentlemanly and efficient captain assembled all the passengers, and to the gay and festive music of the Polk Redowa and Scottisch, the dawning hours of the Fourth were ushered in. Upon the stroke of 8 bells,

headline.main: FOURTH OF JULY.; CELEBRATION OF INDEPENDENCE DAY. How the City Kept It, and What They Did in the Country. First Day Under the Maine Law. THE MILITARY PROCESSION. The Streets. The Fireworks Put Out. How Things Went at "the Institutions." THE TAMMANY CELEBRATION. TRIAL TRIP OF THE OCEAN BIRD, Accidents and Incidents, Fires, Lightning,Thunder and Rain. "NOISE AND CONFUSION."

docs.lead_paragraph: The day was well observed. The weather was fine till 4 o'clock, after which it was rainy. The firing of crackers began the night before and was kept up incessantly. The new liquor law in this City was nowise observed.
docs.snippet: The day was well observed. The weather was fine till 4 o'clock, after which it was rainy. The firing of crackers began the night before and was kept up incessantly. The new liquor law in this City was nowise observed.
